author: Staff Reporter
text:
As many as 18 flying squads and 18 static surveillance squads (3 each for one constituency) were formed to check violations of electoral model code of conduct in Kanyakumari district, said District Election Officer Sajjansingh R. Chavan here on Saturday. Addressing reporters, Mr. Chavan said that these squads would ensure stricter implementation of model code of conduct. The officials appointed to head the squads were apprised about do’s and dont’s by Mr. Chavan.

Mr. Chavan said that 11,166 voters were removed during the purification exercise conducted since the release of final electoral roll on January 20. Local body officials were given strict instructions to remove political posters, banners and wall grafitis. He said that 14 Nodal Officers were appointed to oversee election related works including District Election Control Room, checking EVMs etc.

Voters can verify their names, constituency and other details by sending SMS to the toll free number 1950.

He said out of the total 1,658 polling booths, 150 were identified as sensitive. The polling exercise in all the booths would be videographed. Mr. Chavan also apprised about the election code of conduct to be followed by the political parties at an all-party meeting convened at the Collectorate.

K. Sundaram of AIADMK, C. Leenas Raj of DMK, P. Selvam of NCP, Krishnakumar of BJP, V. Kumarasamy of INC, and P. Gopi of CPI participated. Later in the evening he also conducted a meeting of Returning Officers and Assistant Returning Officers.
title: Squads to check electoral violations: DEO
